title: 2015 Countdown Problem #18: A Vicious Circle
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/solvable/830a6063be.3da5415599.nDV35g.png?width=250"}},{"type":"text","text":"
A circle of diameter 2015 cm has one vertical and one horizontal line, both initially intersecting at the centre of the circle."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The horizontal line is shifted upwards by 20 cm and the vertical line is shifted rightwards by 15 cm."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For each subsequent time, the horizontal line is shifted upwards by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{1}{3}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" the previous distance it shifted, and the vertical line is shifted rightwards by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{1}{3}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" the previous distance it shifted. This process repeats indefinitely."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The end result is shown in the image. Find the difference between the shaded and unshaded areas."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem is part of the set 2015 Countdown Problems.","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"First, we draw a circle.
"},{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/LrdUYYe7XH-01.png?width=1200"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Then draw the vertical and horizontal lines.
"},{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/nfNYIeFSmC-02.png?width=1200"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We now draw the shifted lines where the dashed lines are their original places.
"},{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/bat63KOLMB-03.png?width=1200"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We need to know where they will eventually end."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\lim_{m \to \infty} \sum_{n = 0}^{m} \frac{1}{x^n} = \frac{x}{x - 1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"then
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\lim_{m \to \infty} \sum_{n = 0}^{m} \frac{1}{3^n} = \frac{3}{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The horizontal line will end "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"30"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" cm above of the center while the vertical line will end "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"22.5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" cm to the right of the center."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We now label the sections of the previous figure.
"},{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/F1Ffoyfw3O-04.png?width=1200"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We can see that (from the figure) the following relationships
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"E = I + F"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"H = I + G"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I = (30 cm)(22.5 cm) = 675 {cm}^{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The area of the first quadrant and third quadrant (of the original axes) is
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{\pi}{2} r^2 = A + I + F + G + C"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"while the area of the second quadrant and fourth quadrant (of the original axes) is
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{\pi}{2} r^2 = B + E + D +H"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, the shaded areas(SA) and the unshaded areas(UA) are
"},{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/3XKZVv6Y6j-05.png?width=1200"}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"SA = A +  E + I + H + C"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"UA = B + G + F + D"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Substituting "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"E"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"H"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in terms of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"SA"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" while substituting "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"F"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"G"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in terms of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"UA"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"SA = A +  F + 3I + G + C"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"UA = B + H + E + D - 2I"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now substituting these equations using the previous relationships with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\pi"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", then
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"SA = \frac{\pi}{2} r^2 + 2I"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"UA = \frac{\pi}{2} r^2 - 2I"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now take the difference between the shaded and unshaded areas.
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"|SA - UA| = 4I"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"|SA - UA| = 4(675 {cm}^{2})"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{|SA - UA| = 2700 {cm}^{2}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 2015 Countdown Problem #19: Find the Largest - Part III
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/solvable/830a6063be.165d2f9d8c.BCqa0J.png?width=250"}},{"type":"text","text":"
Which of the following is largest?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A. The value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\alpha"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" given that
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\int _{ 0 }^{ \frac { \pi  }{ 4 }  }{ \tan ^{ \alpha  }{ x } \mbox{ } \sec ^{ 2 }{ x } \mbox{ } dx } =\frac { 1 }{ 2015 } "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"B. The value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\beta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" given that
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\int _{ 0 }^{ \beta  }{ (round\left( x \right) +\left\lceil x \right\rceil -\left\lfloor x \right\rfloor -x)\mbox{ } dx } =2015"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"C. The value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\gamma"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" given that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\gamma"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the area bounded by the three straight lines represented by the equation
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(y+3x+2015)(28x^2-xy+1540x-55y)=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"D. The value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\delta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" given that
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\int { { (1-4060225{ x }^{ 2 }) }^{ -\frac { 1 }{ 2 }  }\times { e }^{ (\sin ^{ -1 }{ 2015x } ) } \mbox{ } dx=\delta { e }^{ (\sin ^{ -1 }{ 2015x } ) }+C } "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
where constant "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"C \in \mathbb{R}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"#MotherOfAllIntegrationProblems","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem is part of the set 2015 Countdown Problems.","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]}]}

title: 2015 Countdown Problem #1: Spelling the New Year
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"How many ways can the letters of
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{TWENTY FIFTEEN}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
be rearranged such that the first and last letter is the same vowel?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem is part of the set 2015 Countdown Problems.","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]}]}

title: 2015 Countdown Problem 20: A Cubic Expansion in a Quadratic Equation
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The roots of the "},{"type":"text","text":"quadratic equation","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":"  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^2-35x+300=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\alpha"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\beta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". The quadratic equation which has only one "},{"type":"text","text":"real","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":" root "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\alpha^3+\beta^3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" can be expressed as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^2-mx+n=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are "},{"type":"text","text":"positive integers","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the sum of digits of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" without using a calculator."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Bonus","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":": Solve this problem without finding the values of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\alpha"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\beta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":6}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem is part of the set 2015 Countdown Problems."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This is the solution for the problem without solving individually for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\alpha"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\beta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\alpha"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\beta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are both roots of the quadratic equation, and the leading coefficient is one, the equation can be written in the form"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(x-\alpha )(x-\beta )=0={ x }^{ 2 }-35x+300"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Expanding, we get"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{ x }^{ 2 }-\alpha x-\beta x+\alpha \beta ={ x }^{ 2 }-35x+300\\{ x }^{ 2 }-(\alpha +\beta )x+\alpha \beta ={ x }^{ 2 }-35x+300"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\alpha +\beta =35\\ \alpha \beta =300"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Taking the first equation and squaring both sides, we get"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{ \left( \alpha +\beta  \right)  }^{ 2 }={ 35 }^{ 2 }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Which expands to "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{ \alpha  }^{ 2 }+2\alpha \beta +{ \beta  }^{ 2 }=1225"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Substituting 300 in for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\alpha \beta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", we get "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\alpha^{ 2 }+2\left( 300 \right) +\beta ^{ 2 }=1225\\\alpha ^{ 2 }+600+\beta ^{ 2 }=1225\\\alpha ^{ 2 }+\beta  ^{ 2 }=625"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, let us look at the second quadratic equation, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{ x }^{ 2 }-mx+n=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". There is only one real root, which is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x={ \alpha  }^{ 3 }+{ \beta  }^{ 3 }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This can be factored to get"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x=\left( { \alpha  }+{ \beta  } \right) \left( { \alpha  }^{ 2 }-\alpha \beta +{ \beta  }^{ 2 } \right) \\ x=\left( { \alpha  }+{ \beta  } \right) \left( \left( { \alpha  }^{ 2 }+{ \beta  }^{ 2 } \right) -\alpha \beta  \right) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Substituting the values that we solved for earlier, we get"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x=\left( 35 \right) \left( 625-300 \right) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Which gives us"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x=11375={ \alpha  }^{ 3 }+{ \beta  }^{ 3 }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x=11375"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the only root of this quadratic equation, it can be written in the form of"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{ \left( x-11375 \right)  }^{ 2 }=0={ x }^{ 2 }-mx+n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Expanding, we get "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{ x }^{ 2 }-22750x+129390625={ x }^{ 2 }-mx+n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n=129390625"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"To get the final solution to the problem, we need to add up all of the digits in n. This is done as such:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1+2+9+3+9+0+6+2+5=\boxed{37}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

replies.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            In order to know this, we look at the discriminant: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{ b }^{ 2 }-4ac"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", which comes from the quadratic formula. If the value of this is positive, the quadratic equation will have two real solutions. If the value is zero, it will have one real solution, a double root. If the value is negative, it will have two complex solutions. I don't believe it is possible for a quadratic equation with real coefficients to have both a real and a complex solution at the same time (please correct me if I'm wrong...) "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Here is the discriminant for this equation:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{ b }^{ 2 }-4ac={ \left( -22750 \right)  }^{ 2 }-4\times 1\times 129390625\\ =517562500-517562500\\ =0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since the discriminant is zero, the quadratic equation will have one real root, which is a double root. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Thank you for pointing this out. I hope this adds some clarity to my above solution.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            If the equation has only one real root then how can you conclude that the other root is real and same....It can be imaginary too....

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"By Vieta's Formulas:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\alpha+\beta=35"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\alpha \beta=300"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^2-mx+n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" only has one real root can be factoring as perfect square "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\therefore x^2-mx+n=(x-(\alpha^3+\beta^3))^2=x^2-2(\alpha^3+\beta^3)x+n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \alpha^3+ \beta^3=(\alpha+ \beta)^3-3(\alpha+ \beta)(\alpha \beta)=35^3-3(35)(300) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"As "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^2-mx+n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  is a perfect square binomial its discriminant is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m=2(11375)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m^2-4(1)(n)=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4(11375)^2=4n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n=11375^2=129390625"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1+2+9+3+9+6+2+5=\boxed{37}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 2015 Countdown Problem #21: Buffon's Clean Tile Game Revisited
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/solvable/830a6063be.3da5415599.Q1dRsX.png?width=250"}},{"type":"text","text":"
A rectangular tile has area "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2015"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" cm^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and perimeter "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"192"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"cm"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". A coin of diameter "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"cm"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is randomly tossed onto a floor laid with such rectangular tiles which tessellated in the following arrangement as shown (checkerboard arrangement)."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be the probability of the coin landing on "},{"type":"text","text":"exactly","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" 2 tiles (i.e. such that when it lands it covers part of exactly two tiles, as shown). Find "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2015P"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem is part of the set 2015 Countdown Problems.","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"l"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"h"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be the longer side and the shorter side of the tile respectively, and d be the diameter of the coin. "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"h=31"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"l=65"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Notice that the blue areas correspond to where the centre of the coin needs to be within for the coin to land on exactly 2 tiles."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/OFaDvPEJGn-1234.png?width=1200"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hence"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P=\frac{\mbox{(total blue area)}}{\mbox{(total tile area)}}=\frac{(2(l-d)(d/2)+2(h-d)(d/2))}{lh}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=\frac{d(l+h-2d)}{lh}=\frac{(2(65+31-2×2))}{2015}=\frac{184}{2015}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

title: 2015 Countdown Problem #2: 1 Jan 2115
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"You are given the following information:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"orderedList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Christmas Day in 2014 (25 December 2014) falls on a Thursday."}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"There are 7 days in a week, and 365 days in a year except for leap years (where there are 366 days)."}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A year is a leap year if:"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"it is divisible by 4 and not divisible by 100, or;"}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"it is divisible by 400."}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"What day is New Year’s Day in 2115 (1 January 2115)?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Please answer:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1 for Monday"}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2 for Tuesday"}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3 for Wednesday"}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4 for Thursday"}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5 for Friday"}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"6 for Saturday"}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"7 for Sunday"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem is part of the set 2015 Countdown Problems.","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Note that 365 = 1 (mod 7), hence a particular date in a calendar year would be shifted one day ahead in the next year (e.g. Christmas 2015 would fall on a Friday). For leap years, it would be shifted two days ahead since 366 = 2 (mod 7)."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Christmas 2015: Friday"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Christmas 2016: Sunday ← Leap Year"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Christmas 2115: Friday + (number of leap years) × (2 days) + (number of non-leap years) × (1 day)
= Friday + 24 × 2 + 75 × 1
= Friday + 5 days (mod 7)
= Tuesday"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 2015 Countdown Problem #22: The Curve
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/solvable/830a6063be.fde979abcf.gy9Ron.png?width=250"}},{"type":"text","text":"
The image shows a part of a graph. Below are four equations:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":": "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y=\frac{2015}{e^x}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"II","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":": "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y=2015{e}^x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"III","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":": "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y={2015}^x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"IV","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":":"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" y=e^{2015x}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Which equation(s), when plotted, will produce the graph above?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem is part of the set 2015 Countdown Problems.","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]}]}

title: 2015 Countdown Problem #23: A Log Cake for Christmas
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/solvable/830a6063be.40bd001563.GjXB8D.gif"}},{"type":"text","text":"
A family baked a log cake for Christmas which is cylindrical in shape. What is the largest possible number of pieces can the cake be divided to by making just three cuts with a straight-edge knife?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"#MerryChristmas","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem is part of the set 2015 Countdown Problems.","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If every cut intersects every previous cut, it will always double the total number of pieces."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2 times 2 times 2 gives you 8"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 2015 Countdown Problem #25: 'O Christmas Tree
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/solvable/830a6063be.2ec795ba01.AUF5oS.jpg?width=250"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"blockquote","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
  "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"‘O Christmas Tree, ‘O Christmas Tree,","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"
  
  "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Your branches green delight us!","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"
  
  "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"They are green when summer days are bright,","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"
  
  "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"They are green when winter snow is white.","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"
  
  "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"‘O Christmas Tree, ‘O Christmas Tree,","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"
  
  "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Your branches green delight us!","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"
"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A gigantic Christmas tree at the atrium of a shopping mall initially had a total of 630 candy cane and snowflake ornaments. Unfortunately a few children playing near the tree damaged the tree, resulting in the mall management removing "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{2}{5}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" of the candy cane ornaments as they are broken. As the mall management couldn’t find any replacement candy cane ornaments, they instead bought and decorated the tree with another 35 snowflake ornaments. After that, the number of snowflake ornaments the Christmas tree now had was "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{4}{13}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" the total number of ornaments the tree now had. How many more candy cane ornaments than snowflake ornaments were there at first?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Photo Credits: http://www.christmas-graphics-plus.com/free/christmas-tree-clipart.html","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem is part of the set 2015 Countdown Problems.","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]}]}
